meanings.definition: To dip or submerge briefly in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She dunked her cookie in milk.
meanings.sent2: He dunked the bread in soup.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy dunked its paw in the puddle.
meanings.sent4: The sun dunked below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The child dunked her toy in the soapy water, creating bubbles.

meanings.sent1: He dunked the basketball into the hoop.
meanings.sent2: The chef dunked the meat onto the cutting board.
meanings.sent3: The angry player dunked the controller on the table.
meanings.sent4: The hammer dunked the nail into the wood effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The storm dunked heavy raindrops on the roof, creating a soothing sound.
